newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B index ends up on domestic buying.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B index ends up on domestic buying.

text.p: Shanghai's B share index ended slightly up on Friday on domestic buying helped by gains on the A share market, brokers said.
The B index edged up 0.17 points or 0.25 percent to 67.157 points on volume of 17.64 million worth $7.88 million.
Brokers said rises on the A share market prompted increased buying by domestic investors on the B share market, resulting in Friday's rises.
The A index rose 16.018 points or 1.5 percent to 1,087.423 points.
"Domestic investors dominated recent market movements because they believe that most B share prices are better value than A shares," one broker said.
Another broker said he expected the index to move in a narrow range early next week as the market awaits the issue of annual reports.
All listed companies are required to issue annual reports by April 30.
Of 43 B shares, 42 traded, with 19 up, eight flat and 15 down.
Tientsin Marine Shipping was the star on a technical rebound after sharp losses over the past few days, rising $0.024 or 5.42 percent to $0.466 on volume of 1.1 million shares.
The most active counter Shanghai Haixin 9009.SS followed, helped by talk of better 1996 results. It gained $0.022 or 4.7 percent to $0.490 on volume of 1.9 million shares.
Shanghai A shares reversed early losses on market expectations of an exchange announcement after the close, brokers said.
The Shanghai stock exchange issued a circular late in the afternoon ordering all brokerages to publicise each day's five most active stocks and the major traders starting next Monday.
A total of 628 million shares worth six billion yuan were traded. The SSE30 index rose 18.162 points or 0.65 percent to 2819.398 points.
Yanzhong Industry was the biggest gainer on speculative buying, surging 0.94 yuan or 10.04 percent to 10.3 yuan on volume of 9.5 million.
